author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 1,306 First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered on charges of violations of Model Code of Conduct (MCC) and cash to the tune of Rs. 9.64 crore has been confiscated by officials during regular and random vehicular checks as on March 17, according to the Election Commission.

Other items

During the checks, besides cash, officials have aslo seized wall clocks, gas tubes and liquor bottles, an official release stated.

While the Static Surveillance Teams have confiscated over Rs. 3 crore, flying squads have seized over Rs. 5 crore, it added. Officials have also received 1.43 lakh complaints alleging damage to public and private property as on Saturday.
title: Over 1,300 FIRs registered for violation
